00017 package WeBWorK::DB::Schema::NewSQL::Merge;
00018 use base qw(WeBWorK::DB::Schema::NewSQL);
00019 
00020 =head1 NAME
00021 
00022 WeBWorK::DB::Schema::NewSQL::Merge - get merged records from multiple tables in
00023 an SQL database.
00024 
00025 =cut
00026 
00027 use strict;
00028 use warnings;
00029 use Carp qw(croak);
00030 use Iterator;
00031 use Iterator::Util;
00032 use WeBWorK::DB::Utils::SQLAbstractIdentTrans;
00033 use WeBWorK::Debug;
00034 
00035 =head1 SUPPORTED PARAMS
00036 
00037 This schema pays attention to the following items in the C<params> entry.
00038 
00039 =over
00040 
00041 =item merge
00042 
00043 A reference to an array listing the tables to merge, from highest priority to
00044 lowest priority.
00045 
00046 =back
00047 
00048 =cut
00049 
00050 ################################################################################
00051 # constructor for merge-specific behavior
00052 ################################################################################
00053 
00054 sub new {
00055     my $self = shift->SUPER::new(@_);
00056     
00057     $self->merge_init;
00058     $self->sql_init;
00059     
00060     return $self;
00061 }
00062 
00063 sub merge_init {
00064     my $self = shift;
00065     my $db = $self->{db};
00066     
00067     my @merge_tables = @{$self->{params}{merge}};
00068     
00069     my %sql_table_aliases;
00070     @sql_table_aliases{@merge_tables} = map { "merge$_" } 1 .. @merge_tables;
00071     
00072     my @sql_tableexprs;
00073     my %sql_field_names;
00074     foreach my $table (@merge_tables) {
00075         push @sql_tableexprs, "`" . $db->{$table}->sql_table_name . "` AS `$sql_table_aliases{$table}`";
00076         my @fields = $db->{$table}->fields;
00077         @{$sql_field_names{$table}}{@fields} = map { $db->{$table}->sql_field_name($_) } @fields;
00078     }
00079     
00080     my $pri = $merge_tables[0];
00081     
00082     my %sql_fieldexprs;
00083     my @sql_whereprefix;
00084     
00085     foreach my $field ($db->{$pri}->fields) {
00086         my $sql_field_name = $sql_field_names{$pri}{$field};
00087         
00088         if ($db->{$pri}->field_data->{$field}{key}) {
00089             # if it's a keyfield, use the version from the primary table
00090             # (they're all going to be the same anyway)
00091             $sql_fieldexprs{$field} = $db->{$pri}->sql_field_expression($field, $sql_table_aliases{$pri});
00092             
00093             # add this field to the where clause, by matching the value in the
00094             # primary table to the values in all other tables that have that field
00095             foreach my $table (@merge_tables[1..$#merge_tables]) {
00096                 next unless exists $db->{$table}->field_data->{$field};
00097                 push @sql_whereprefix,
00098                     $db->{$pri}->sql_field_expression($field, $sql_table_aliases{$pri})
00099                     . "=" . $db->{$table}->sql_field_expression($field, $sql_table_aliases{$table});
00100             }
00101         } else {
00102             # if it's not a keyfield, we use the COALESCE function to select a
00103             # value from the table that has the first non-NULL value
00104             my @coalesce;
00105             foreach my $table (@merge_tables) {
00106                 next unless exists $db->{$table}->field_data->{$field};
00107                 push @coalesce, $db->{$table}->sql_field_expression($field, $sql_table_aliases{$table});
00108             }
00109             # VERSIONING: we may need something other than COALESCE() here as well, because 
00110             # it works with NULL/not-NULL, and SUBSTRING() returns empty strings if no match.
00111             $sql_fieldexprs{$field} = "COALESCE(" . join(",", @coalesce) . ")";
00112         }
00113     }
00114     
00115     $self->{pri} = $pri;
00116     $self->{sql_table_aliases} = \%sql_table_aliases;
00117     $self->{sql_field_names} = \%sql_field_names;
00118     $self->{sql_fieldexprs} = \%sql_fieldexprs;
00119     $self->{sql_whereprefix} = join(" AND ", @sql_whereprefix);
00120     $self->{sql_tableexpr} = join(", ", @sql_tableexprs);
00121 }
00122 
00123 sub sql_init {
00124     my $self = shift;
00125     
00126     # transformation functions for table and field names: these allow us to pass
00127     # the WeBWorK table/field names to SQL::Abstract, and have it translate them
00128     # to the SQL table/field names from tableOverride and fieldOverride.
00129     # (Without this, it would be hard to translate field names in WHERE
00130     # structures, since they're so convoluted.)
00131     my $transform_table = sub {
00132         my $label = shift;
00133         if (exists $self->{sql_table_aliases}{$label}) {
00134             return $self->{sql_table_aliases}{$label};
00135         } else {
00136             warn "can't transform unrecognized table name '$label'";
00137             return $label;
00138         }
00139     };
00140     
00141     # This transformation is called both on bare field names and on qualified
00142     # field names (i.e. "table.field"), but not on bare table names.
00143     my $transform_all = sub {
00144         my $label = shift;
00145         my ($table, $field) = $label =~ /(?:(.+)\.)?(.+)/;
00146         $table = $self->{pri} unless defined $table;
00147         if (exists $self->{sql_field_names}{$table}{$field}) {
00148             $field = $self->{sql_field_names}{$table}{$field};
00149         } else {
00150             warn "can't transform unrecognized field name '$field' for table name '$table'";
00151         }
00152         $table = $transform_table->($table);
00153         return "`$table`.`$field`";
00154     };
00155     
00156     # add SQL statement generation object
00157     $self->{sql} = new WeBWorK::DB::Utils::SQLAbstractIdentTrans(
00158         quote_char => "`",
00159         name_sep => ".",
00160         transform_table => $transform_table,
00161         transform_all => $transform_all,
00162     );
00163 }

00165 ################################################################################
00166 # lowlevel get
00167 ################################################################################
00168 
00169 *get_fields_where = *WeBWorK::DB::Schema::NewSQL::Std::get_fields_where;
00170 *get_fields_where_i = *WeBWorK::DB::Schema::NewSQL::Std::get_fields_where_i;
00171 
00172 # helper, returns a prepared statement handle
00173 sub _get_fields_where_prepex {
00174     my ($self, $fields, $where, $order) = @_;
00175     $where = $self->conv_where($where);
00176     
00177     # pull the requested fields out of $self->{sql_fieldexprs}
00178     my $sql_fields = join(", ", @{$self->{sql_fieldexprs}}{@$fields});
00179     
00180     my @where = $self->{sql_whereprefix};
00181     my @bind_vals;
00182     
00183     my ($base_where_clause, @base_bind_vals) = $self->sql->_recurse_where($where) if $where;
00184     if (defined $base_where_clause and $base_where_clause =~ /\S/) {
00185         push @where, $base_where_clause;
00186         push @bind_vals, @base_bind_vals;
00187     }
00188     
00189     my $where_clause = @where ? "WHERE " . join(" AND ", @where) : "";
00190     my $order_by_clause = $order ? $self->sql->_order_by($order) : "";
00191     
00192     # scalar ref so _quote_table will leave table expression alone
00193     my $stmt = $self->sql->select(\($self->{sql_tableexpr}), $sql_fields)
00194         . " $where_clause $order_by_clause";
00195     
00196     my $sth = $self->dbh->prepare_cached($stmt, undef, 3); # 3: see DBI docs
00197     $self->debug_stmt($sth, @bind_vals);
00198     $sth->execute(@bind_vals);  
00199     return $sth;
00200 }
00201 
00202 ################################################################################
00203 # override where clause handlers to use versions from schema of primary table
00204 ################################################################################
00205 
00206 sub conv_where {
00207     my $self = shift;
00208     return $self->{db}{$self->{pri}}->conv_where(@_);
00209 }
00210 
00211 sub keyparts_to_where {
00212     my $self = shift;
00213     return $self->{db}{$self->{pri}}->keyparts_to_where(@_);
00214 }
